        Parameters:

        Returns:
        String containing the job log.

      • insert

        public int insert(DODJob job,
         java.lang.String log)
        Inserts a job in the database with a log. This method is used to insert jobs only for logging purposes, like enabling or disabling backups. It is a single insert, it does not update the instance or insert any parameters. It simple inserts the job for logging purposes. That is why the job is always in state FINISHED.
        Parameters:
        job - job to be inserted.
        log - log for the job.
        Returns:
        1 if the operation was successful, 0 otherwise.

      • insert

        public int insert(DODJob job,
         java.util.List<DODCommandParam> params)
        Inserts a job in the database, to be picked up by the daemon.
        Parameters:
        job - job to be inserted.
        params - parameters to be inserted with the job.
        Returns:
        1 if the operation was successful, 0 otherwise.

      • createScheduledBackup

        public boolean createScheduledBackup(DODInstance instance,
                            java.lang.String requester,
                            java.util.Date startDate,
                            int intervalHours,
                            int admin)
        Creates a scheduled backup.
        Parameters:
        instance - instance to enable backups on.
        requester - user requesting automatic backups.
        startDate - date to start backups
        interval_hours - hours between snapshots.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • getBackupInterval

        public int getBackupInterval(DODInstance instance)
        Obtains the hours interval for the scheduled backups of a given instance.
        Parameters:
        instance - DOD instance to get the interval of.
        Returns:
        interval, in hours, for the scheduled backups. 0 in case scheduled backups are not enabled.

      • getBackupStartDate

        public java.util.Date getBackupStartDate(DODInstance instance)
        Checks automatic backups start date.
        Parameters:
        instance - DOD instance to get the start date.
        Returns:
        start date for backups for the given instance, null otherwise.

      • createScheduledBackupToTape

        public boolean createScheduledBackupToTape(DODInstance instance,
                                  java.lang.String username,
                                  java.util.Date startDate,
                                  int admin)
        Creates scheduled backups to tape.
        Parameters:
        instance - instance to enable backups to tape for.
        username - username requesting this job.
        startDate - date to start backups to tape.
        admin - 1 if user is admin, 0 otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • deleteScheduledBackupToTape

        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • getBackupToTapeStartDate

        public java.util.Date getBackupToTapeStartDate(DODInstance instance)
        Checks if backups to tape are enabled or disabled, and returns the start date.
        Parameters:
        instance - DOD instance to get the start date of.
        Returns:
        start date for backups to tape for the given instance, null otherwise.
